comment: His class is easy, however he is a tough grader and he sometimes can be passive aggressive and a know it all at times. Overall a good professor just a couple things to watch out for.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I won't lie this was a hard course, however if you go to class regularly, ask questions, and actively listen you will do great. I got a lot of great writing tips and tricks from this class, and by the end of the course I was quite proud of what I wrote!

I took him for 1101 and 1102. He's a great professor and has clear instructions on all of his assignments. If you really want to do well on papers, go to his office hours in person or online. He's funny and very engaging. Just take him!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Get ready to write. He is a nice guy, but extremely passive-aggressive and can even be rude at times. The work we were assigned was very straightforward and well explained, but he is an extremely tough grader.
Would have been 5 stars if he let me look at golf clubs during class.

it was a 3 test class with no exams, which was nice. however, he is extremely passive-aggressive and can be annoying at times. He is a sweet person but just very passive-aggressive. my best advice, if you are taking his class is to make sure that you get a lot of people to proofread your essays as he is very picky in his grading.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: He's a nice man, I like his personality but it's not for everyone and he can be a little snappy. Had 3 papers total
rating_tags: So many papers--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Super nice and funny guy. He'll grade pretty tough on major papers, but all class work and drafts are easy 100s. He's very understanding of personal circumstances. He's really down to earth and tries to connect with his students on a personal level. It may not be an easy A, but this guy is a great teacher and you genuinely will learn a lot.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: He's funny and he is a tough grader. He's not just gonna give you an A on your final paper because its decent and you turned it in, you really have to earn that A. He is loud and makes sure the class participates in discussions about the readings so if you don't participate he will give out a reading quiz or extra homework over the reading.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: He was very annoying and hard to work with. He was very limiting when it came to writing our essays, especially the narrative essay. There was also a sense of pretentiousness when it came to critiquing essays, at least for me. He isn't too difficult so as long as you keep your head down and keep up with the material, you should be fine.

He's one of those English teachers that wants you to be excessively descriptive with your narrative if that gives you an idea. He's also not very personal or engaging, but that might be because I took the online course. Outside of that, he's an alright teacher.

he was ok, superrrrrr passive aggresive. the class wasn't hard at all but you do have to go. he is a good professor and gives thought out feedback but he was just so high strung at times over things that were never that serious. the whole class basically revolved around one paper, and if you email him he acts like its a big inconvenience.

Dr. Chamberlain is fantastic to work with. He very obviously wants his students to do good and gives many chances. He does curse a bit which can be off-putting for some students but he does make lectures fun. The only complaint I have is that he can come off as passive aggressive in announcements and over email some times.

Honestly wasn't my favorite class. He was always passive-aggressive and honesty can be rude at times. He gets along with some but not all. I've seen him humiliate students. He's a tough grader and nitpicks at everything wrong in your paper. He just wasn't the professor for me.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Cool teacher, Kind of passive aggressive sometimes and if he curses he just kinda keeps going until its too much. He gives good advice on essays, he does 3 drafts for each of your 3 essays. Only reason I did bad was because of laziness. He is a bit nitpicky once you get to A territory though, he said it in class himself. Solid choice :)

Mr. Cory is a great professor and gives good feedback on all essays (drafts). He allows 3 draft essays before final essay is graded which is more than enough for a large amount of feedback. If you come to class you will get a good participation grade & he is amazing for first time freshmen. Would take him again.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: This professor is very passive agressive, but he provides the resources you need to write a good essay. He grades kind of harsh. Your grade consists of 3 essays.
I had all semester to write my final paper and of course waited till the last second. He let me turn it in late and I still made an A.

Mr. Cory Chamberlin, what a funny dude he is. He acts like he's friendly and cares, and overall he does(ish). He's just intimidating, I feel scared to ask him questions because of how sassy he is. When I ask questions, he would literally laugh in my face, and make me feel dumb for even asking a question.
He is a good teacher and gives you many chances to do good.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: As long as you attend the lectures and give him your best effort, he's willing to work with you. Office hours are accessible, and he will always email back. He truly cares for his students, and their successes! If given the opportunity I would take him again! :)

Take Cory Chamberlain, you are allowed 3 absences, but I enjoyed his class, he's funny and does a great job at not just explaining but showing what he wants on the papers. By far the best teacher/prof I've ever had. There's 3 papers and a weekly assignment but all of the assignments prepare you for the papers. Take Cory Chamberlain.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment:
Professor Chamberlian is a great professor . I took him for ENGL 1101 and 1102 . He is very understanding , respectful and funny . Although he assigns long papers for each class its a new draft due , and the writing center really helps and so does the professor . FYI for Engl 1102 the final paper was 8-12 pages . 
TAKE HIM

Professor Chamberlain was one of the best language arts TEACHERS I've ever had. His personality and tone are definitely not for everyone. I did not want to participate because he would say things that made me feel stupid. If you're looking for an easy class to coast through this is definitely not the one for you. I would not take it again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Very passive aggressive professor. Basically out of luck if you miss an assignment or two, and makes you feel bad for them. Rude in emails, and there are too many papers in this class. I would not recommend taking his course.

Overall good professor, but you need to be present in his course, or else he will call you out &/or hold it against you for the semester. Only 3 absences allowed. Very passive-aggressive 100%. 3 big papers carry your grade along with mini free write submissions at the start of class. Take him if you have to. Took him Fall 2021.
Chamberlain was a great professor. The only thing to know is he hears every sound in that class and lowkey made him upset sometimes but overall very very great professor

His classes are very helpful and the essays are not necessarily hard. He always gives feedback and will let you redo papers if you get lower than an 89. Very passionate about his job and he's funny (to me).Only complaints I have is that he can be very passive aggressive and condescending towards people and it was hard to please him with the papers.

Attendance is required. You're allowed to miss three classes before he takes 5 points off your final grade. Cool guy, and accessible office hours. He's a pretty strict grader but the assignments are clear. Not too much homework either.

Has a chill sense of humor but tends to be passive-aggressive. Important grades are 3 essays throughout the semester. Does assign occasional group work and never any quizzes or tests. Attendance matters. Seriously, don't skip. Gives great advice on your papers so when writing essays make sure to submit drafts because his advice will get you an A.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: No test , barley any assignments. He focuses more on the papers . I would recommend any student to take his class . Very good teacher . Energy is always on point . Gives good feed bad . Willing to help students succeed. Take this class if you can !!

Mr. Chamberlain teaches this class really well. He will definitely make you a better writer by the end of the semester. Attendance is important, if you miss more than 3 classes your grade goes down. Homework and essays make up most of your grade. If you do the work, write good essays, and show up to class, you'll get A. Good feedback on drafts.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Good teacher but very passive-aggressive. Downright rude in emails, too. Easy assignments, but NOT a teacher I would take again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: He was constantly passive aggressive about every comment he made. He made students feel bad even for mistakes, even if the mistake was his own. This was the worst professor I have ever had.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: He's great, but he can be passive-aggressive sometimes in his emails. There are 3 papers you are graded on and he gives good feedback. Mr. Chamberlain wants you to do good in the class, so he is willing to help. The only thing is there are A LOT of small assignments you're graded on. You have to show up though because participation is a grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Textbook is used and class attendance is required (although skipping class is to your disadvantage). Heavy emphasis on in-class work because it builds your way to your final paper that is most of your grade.

Yes we did use a textbook but only like twice throughout the semester. We were basically graded on 3 papers and apart from the last one (because there would be no time) we were allowed to rewrite the papers if we didnt like our scores after he gave us descriptive feedback the first time. Definitely recommend for engl1101.
Very nice guy. Always gives great feedback on everything you do in the class. Show up to the class and actually participate in class discussions and you'll do great.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Dr.C is great. He is very caring about his students and is passionate about what he teaches. He offers rewrites and is always willing and able to help you. Would recommend taking him for sure!
He was overall a really good, chill professor. He gives really good feedback on writing and is always available if you need help. You have to work for your grade but thats usually how it is.

English 1101 Professor/Doctor Chamberlain has to be one of if not the best English Professor Ive ever had. His feedback is very constructive, and he is always available to help. I have learned how to be a better writer and I enjoy writing a lot more than I did before his class. If you can take him, definitely take the opportunity.
